name: Sumo Balls (Ali Murtaza)
description:
Welcome to Sumo Balls, a fast-paced arcade game created as a learning experience.

Instructions:

Enemies will appear in waves and attack you. They will strike you and try to push you over the edge. You must remain on the ground and push them off in order to defeat them.

Game Modes:

Classic Mode -  There are a total of 10 waves. If you defeat them all, you win. It is recommended that you finish this before trying out arcade mode.

Arcade Mode -  There is no limit to the number of waves. Your goal is to get as high of a score as you can.

Controls:

- Press WASD or ARROW KEYS to move around.

- Press SPACE to use the green power up.

- Press ESCAPE to pause and resume the game.

Enemy Health:

All enemies have their own health bars. An enemy's health will heal the longer you do not attack him. If it reaches 0, he will stop moving for a while, giving you a chance to push him off.

Power Ups:

Yellow  -  This makes you tougher. Your attacks will be stronger and attacks on you will be less effective.

Red -  This makes you fire bullets at all enemies, doing significant damage to them.

Green -  This allows you to jump up and smash down on the ground, damaging all the enemies who are near and pushing them away.

Score Rules:

In arcade mode the amount of score you gain depends on your current multiplier.

Every time you defeat an enemy, your multiplier increases and the multiplier bar fills up.

The bar will decrease over time, faster if you stay near the center. When it becomes empty, your multiplier will decrease.

To increase your multiplier you must stay away from the center and defeat enemies as quick as you can.

Credits:

Music by Cyberleaf Studio.

Sound Effects by Dustyroom, Little Robot Sound Factory, and cabled_mess.

I am an 18 year old student at the time of releasing. I am learning unity and this is the first game that I have created after getting a basic understanding of the unity engine. The idea that I built up on is from one of the tutorial prototypes I used to get started in the engine. I have worked hard to make this a fun experience and I hope that you will like it.  :)

I would highly appreciate your feedback down in the comments.
